result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony A. Turner II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: **05/03/2017 AMENDMENT:  The term of probation on Count 2 is hereby amended to One (1) year which is the maximum term allowed by Statute for this charge.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
--------------------------------------

Maintain full time school or full time employment or a combination of the two.
--------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.   No contact with victims. No contact with co-defendants.
--------------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
--------------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
--------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete 100 hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations returned in mail
Order for Community Service
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

10:43 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Tony A. Turner in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  
Matter is before the court for a sentencing hearing.  Parties have a joint recommendation on everything except the issue of expungement.  
Record made with regard to victim notification.  
10:44 am  Atty Anderson recites terms of the plea agreement.  
10:45 am  Atty Wiedenfeld indicates that the State's agreement is to remain silent.  
10:46 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Anderson.  
10:52 am  Response by deft to Court's questions regarding his current employment.  
10:53 am  Statement by defendant's mother, Alice Johnson.  
10:56 am  Attys confirm that Mr. Turner has a prior 2011 conviction for DC out of Racine County.  
10:57 am  Statement by defendant / response to Court's questions.  
11:01 am  Court makes record and will grant expungement.  

SENTENCE:  
Withheld sentence, 2 years probation;  
CONDITIONS:  
1)  $100 fine plus court costs;  
2)  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No contact with victim(s).  No contact with co-defendants.  
3)  Possess no weapons.  
4)  Complete 100 hours of CSW without buyout option.  
5)  Maintain full time school or full time employment or a combination of the two.  
6)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
7)  AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.  
8)  Special disposition per Sec. 973.015 with NO VIOLATIONS OF THE RULES OF PROBATION.  

Court warns defendant:  1)  He may not vote until civil rights are restored;  2)  He may not possess a firearm;  No pre-sentence credit.  
11:06 am  Court in recess.
Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party. NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S) J.R.S. AND R.M.M.  NO CONTACT WITH WITNESSES/RESIDENCE T.H. AND R.L.T. AND G.S. AND J.C.
